documents.document: @Huw_Badman pretty stripped out compared to the 2004. Massive autolysis flavours but still has the soul of a Thomas Hardy's after so long!

@SomeGuyCalum @TuataraBrew you would think so... Which is why I'm interested in Tuatara's thinking beind the application.
@TuataraBrew care to offer any insight into why you thought you should have the Trademark on the name of a hop being used widely across NZ?
@timnicholas it's not trade marked in NZ though.
@BarnBocock 'Farmhouse Ale' was actually granted last year. SOBA opposed and it was smartly withdrawn. 'Kapai' is another upcoming one.
@BarnBocock not an agreement,its law that you cant TM these sorts of terms.Theyll never get it but the fact that they're trying says a lot.
In this episode of trademark shenanigans: @TuataraBrew try to trade mark 'Amarillo'. What the hell? #NotYoursToOwn https://t.co/o9X6PilYyx
